Arctic Hare

Posted on August 16, 2017August 21, 2017 admin

Arctic hares can be found in the North American  tundra. Unlike most of the rabbits, Arctic hare has adapted to the harsh tundra enviroment. For example, it’s fur changes color according to the season – white during the winter (for sunray absorption and snow blending) and gray for the summer. However, in the nortest parts of the arctic it’s fur is while all year around.  Also it has small ears so it doesn’t lose body heat. Arctic hares are herbivores and their favourite food is grass, also they have long claws so they find food easier or dug den.

In the past polar hares have been hunted a lot, for their thick fur and meat, which lead to decreasing their population. Nowdays, however, their population is pretty stable and are least concerned according to IUCN Red list status. This shows that althought Arctic hares look small and fragile, they are well-adapted and resistant.
